snippet: Calling protesters “looters” and “bums,” Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that plans to demolish a public park would continue, despite public opposition.
abstract: Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan dismisses tens of thousands of protesters who battled with police in streets of Istanbul, calling them 'looters' and 'bums'; vows to push ahead with plans to demolish public park that triggered spasm of public anger.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Tim Arango contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Calling protesters “looters” and “bums,” Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that plans to demolish a public park would continue, despite public opposition.

headline.seo: Turkey Premier Says Protests Will Not Stop Demolition Plans
headline.main: Turkish Leader Says Protests Will  Not Stop Plans for Park
headline.print_headline: Turkey Premier Says Protests Won’t Stop Demolition
